review_title: Good community, lower pay but lots of "intangible" benefits.
pros: Wofford is a fun environment in which the staff interacts well with the students and, since it's a small school, there is a good community sense of community.  As a staff member the administration encourages you in your professional goals by providing flexibility in the work schedule for taking additional classes (1 is paid for by the college per semester).  The academic environment at Wofford provides for stimulating conversations, and the Spartanburg area is growing rapidly in terms of weekend outing possibilities and stuff to do on weeknights.  The benefits package provided for employees is competitive, and many perks such as "staff development funds" etc. make the lower salaries more tolerable.
cons: The employees generally enjoy their jobs but don't get paid as much as similar jobs in other schools (though I've heard the salaries have increased since I was there).  Also, most people I worked with ended up working more than 40 hours a week and often worked "on call" hours as well.  Also on the down side, there is little inter-department interaction so staff members may still be meeting other staff members 8 months into the year and may even finish the academic year without having gotten to know entire department teams.  Also, although it's growing, Spartanburg is still a SMALL town.

review_title: Great way to make money during school and get job experience
pros: Legitimate job experience that has impressed future employers. As a development associate, students learn real skills that are useful in future jobs.
cons: Very boring, and the people can occasionally be rude. inconvenient times that conflict with lots of campus events. You actually have to work as opposed to other campus jobs where you mostly do homework with an occasional task.
